alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 8:44PM EDT until July 29 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Somerset County in southeastern Maryland... Southwestern Worcester County in southeastern Maryland... Northern Accomack County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 844 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lawsonia, or 18 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Lawsonia, West Pocomoke, Marion Station, Tylerton, Hallwood, Horntown, Mappsville, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Shelltown, Sanford, Oak Hall, Assawoman, Beaver Dam, Byrdtown, and Fairmount. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
